comments.commentBody:
From time to time the Catholics get it right. This is one of those times.

The policy of this non-believer: just give. The disposition of that small gift is, as my believing friends might say, between the recipient and his god.

Looking the recipient in the eye brings a touch of humanity to a tortured human being.

This is the same advice a Buddhist nun who has many followers gives.  However, she adds that one should give five or ten dollars (or as much as you can), not just a dollar or some change.  She said that when she lived in San Francisco that she would make sure she had cash before going out and that she had it organized and ready to hand out so that there was no fumbling around.  She also emphasizes that it's not our concern what the recipients do with the money.

Agree, doling out tiny sums is not going to help much, give something that can buy something like $10-20 as often as possible, it may be only once a week but probably does more than giving out tiny amounts.  $1 today is like giving 25 cents.

"Please do not give them money" said a San Francisco city social worker friend as we walked or drove around downtown passing people holding cups or signs containing a story. Some she knew, homeless people were her only clients.
She outlined all the services and money provided her clients and said they use the money for illegal street drugs and alcohol that are not helping them. Enabling some to avoid taking their prescribed medications that do help them.

I firmly support the pope's sentiments. At the same time the church owns more than a trillion dollars in property in both real estate and artifacts. What if they just take that dough snd give it to the poor, or better yet, offer it to organizations that help the poor, run by people with no motive for personal enrichment?

I understand your point but don't forget they do operate many organizations that provide direct help to the poor, and have for centuries. Running out of money entirely and selling off art works would put an eventual end to that practice.

Many shelters are shunned because they are unsafe. Further, the nature of the illness of mental instability makes it nigh impossible for many to keep to a regimen agencies require for treatment.

I do agree with an apple a day that the pope is not infallible. He does though err on the side of charity which is more than some say.

Interesting, indeed, Pope.
In our travels among base communities in Guatemala, our host asked us not to give to those seeking donations. Our host worked with the poorest of the poor, and had his life (and that of his family) threatened numerous times.
Instead, he asked that we extend a verbal blessing and that we seek out and give generously to an organization that would make a significant difference in literacy, co-op establishment, small ag via community plots of lands, skill based training.
Since have opted to go with our hosts approach rather than the Pope's.
it is not a black and white  either or situation

comments.userLocation: southern, by the grace of God
comments.commentBody:
Had Mr. Sessions declined to meet with the Russian ambassador, this fair-minded sheet would have called him unpardonably churlish.
Could not I have met that man, too, if he were willing?
Better get some salve on that dum-dum wound, Tito.

You seem to forget that he was meeting with him AFTER the news of the Russian hacking broke.  Such a story might have made you and be a bit cautious to be in the same room, perhaps with your i-phone operating.  But, no, Sessions invites him to his Senate office.  Why?  He should have been a persona non gratia at that point.  Then why lie about it if it were really just an innocent chat?  Alas, the more the stick stirs, the ranker the smell.  What possible purpose does the AG have in meeting with a Russian diplomat?  To discuss human rights?  Wouldn't that have been a laugh.

comments.userLocation: southern, by the grace of God
comments.commentBody:
"...because he knew he could/would win."

He didn't expect to win. But once again the country lucked out.

They are all a bunch of "bad hombres" who should all be investigated for their roles in allowing Russia to basically take over our election process.  What is even more frightening is how easily it all went down and how gullible many of our citizens seem to be.   And this morning trump is tweeting his allegations accusing President Obama of wire tapping trump tower...it is so like him to go with the shiny object theme along with conspiracy theory; what a recipe for disaster.

So what?
When wil the media begin covering issues that matter?

The issue that Russian  meddling in the US election process and Trump's complicity in it with treasonous malfeasance now looming as a real possibility doesn't matter?  What side of your toast do you butter in the morning?
Treason and sedition matter.

"You can look at this several different ways, but I think I speak for many Americans when I say that having a debate about whether Bill Clinton or Jeff Sessions is the worse liar is not the way I want to spend my spring."  Well, it would be worth it if you wrote about it some more....
Rachel Maddox went into all of this just tonight. Scary stuff.. I urge everyone to watch it .

Red States are generally taker welfare queen states. They take more federal dollars than they give. According to Walker, this should stop. Let no state receive more federal dollars than it gives. Within states, rural areas always take more tax money than they give. End that! And, poor people need more resources that they give to society. This must stop. In  short, end all redistribution. Your six year old should be able to fend for himself. Time to make a stand. Let the little brat earn his own lunch money.
Jefferson Beauregard Sessions III is 5ft 7in tall; a man of short stature with a Napoleon complex.

We have to see this for what it really is.
Nothing more than a Democratic attempt to distract the public's attention from the real foreign threats facing the nation.
Benghazi and Hillary's emails.
Come everybody. Chant with me. For old times sake. You remember.
"Lock her up.....Lock her up." Yes, indeed, "Lock HER up?"
Ah! Good times. Good times.

He is, like some in the South, a charming thug, a pariah with no ethics, integrity or a moral compass. And this man was chosen, not as Sec. of Housing or Sec. of Transportation, but "Attorney General". Think of that! "Attorney General"! The AG!

The AG is the up-keeper of law who has to demonstrate, beyond any doubt, that he maintains the highest levels of, and practices the highest standards in, honesty, ethics, integrity, transparency, objectivity, understanding of the law and its complexity. This wrinkled pixie looking moron, with a racist history and attitude, who would not get a job cleaning McDonald's toilet...is now in charge of the highest bench?

Who cares if this wrinkled pickle-passing for AG met with the Russians or the Maoris or the Bhils...Why did he lie about it?

When you lie to the hearing committee, which is like lying in your job interview, you should be out of there...with nothing but a janitor's job, and without the license to practice law ever again. It is that simple!

Full Stop!
Whatever became of that Edward Snowden fellow ?
Only in Cleveland is the euphemism of the year.

"And we will be further distracted from solving real problems..."

You mean, like getting rid of Stephen Bannon, whom you "support 75%"?

B-B-B-B good bye Beauregard.
You play with the sword, you die by the sword.
The entire world starting with the USA is so better off without you. How about you go back to Alabama and raise some hogs for the next state
fair. This would be much more suited to your beliefs and expertise. Just go away you insignificant little twerp!
Our nation us so much better off with out you!
drb/Seattle

comments.userLocation: Fair Verona where we lay our scene
comments.commentBody:
I don't know why thirty Democratic Senators talked to the Russian Ambassador just during the Iran tribute money deal but that's been going on for decades.
Senate Democrats were in constant touch with Soviets here and abroad during Ted Kennedy's war against President Reagan. When Reagan won the Cold War, it counted as a victory over Teddy, too.

The guy usually sits with Democrats, his ideological comrades, when there is a special event like the recent Trump speech. He sat with the Dems then. Mr. Obama also spoke with his dozens of times at the While House, both before and after promising Putin to be more flexible after his re-election.

Squawking that there's some kind of voodoo going on resurrects the title of Episode One of Star Wars,
THE PHANTOM MENACE.

comments.userLocation: Fair Verona where we lay our scene
comments.commentBody:
Mr. Sessions put a killer of a black person on Death Row. He also bankrupted the Alabama KKK organization.
Something tells me the angry hard Left has done nothing for making black people in Alabama safer as Mr. Sessions did.
When they are that busy hating there isn't much need to leave Mom's basement.
How can we have any confidence in an attorney general who lies?  Your time is up, Mr. Sessions - resign before you're impeached.
The American public does not care which is the sorriest thing about this.
SOME of the American public doesn't care,  would be a more accurate statement

Sessions, Page, Christie, Gulliani, Kushner, children, et al have no idea what is going on. All they know is that they have to back Trump 100% or be blackballed by Trump and the GOP.

The only person who really knows what the Russians have and why the administration people and GOP are playing nice to the Russians is Donald Trump. Congress needs to hold hearings to find out the why. End of story.

It's just like WWII, you can't sit on the sidelines. You're either one side or the other. The greatest generation chose. Are you listening John McCain?
